title: Mac Client won't log in. "Unexpected Error occurred while logging in"
body:
Every time I try to log in I get this error:

"An unexpected error occurred while logging in. Please try again. If this issue persists, contact support at support.riotgames.com"

So I try to log in again but it just authenticates for a while. I've tried reinstalling the client, rebooting my mac, and clearing my browsing history and cookies. I'm in Vancouver WA right now and I normally play in Idaho. It used to work just fine in Idaho but now that I'm in Vancouver I get this problem.

Does anyone know of a solution to this?

replies.body: Are you playing with a "nothing-blocking-proxy" than this may be the same as this "newer" post: [LINK](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/hpFBBnQ9-client-login-problems)

Hey churro777,
I've got the same problem for months now and I still dont have a solution. The difference between our problems is that I'm only playing League of Legends on Windows client but your issues are exactly the same to me. 
What I've tried these months is everthing the Rioters told me to do in other topics from other persons with the same issues. 
One thing helped me, downloading 'hotspot shield' and enabling it when I played LoL (not recommended by the Rioters).
https://www.hotspotshield.com/
It doesnt fix the error, but you can play League of Legends when you enable it...

The correct network you're using might be unstable or blocking you from reaching the authentication servers.  If you're able to troubleshoot within your current network, I recommend following each step of the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to help fix this up.  Let me know if you have any questions!
